710357f.text:
Ninth Avenue, at West 29th Street, showing the terminus of the Greenwich Street 9 Ninth Avenue Elevated Railroad. and one of its cars. This is the experimental line using a wire cable as the means of power. Steahm locomotion replaced this later. The station is at the N.E. corner. For additional views see Greenwich Street at Dey Street,
and Ninth Avenue at Gansevoort Street.
1867-8
Gift of Major Quinn
Awg P2o 122

710362f-a.text:
Ninth Avenue, west side, from 29th to 30th Streets. What would have been a view north is cut off by the elevated station at
30th Street.
September 27, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.

710358f-b.text:
Ninth '-venue (Toreground of No. 1 and not seen), at the N.W. corner of west 29th Street, (left) showing the "Milk Sheds" of the New York Central Railroad. These occupy the entire block bounued by 29th and 30th Streets; and Ninth and CTenth Avenues. In the Spring of 1931 tney will be razeo for the new Parcel Post office of the Post Office. Steel for same will rise in February
1932.
Views 2 and 3 show the southerly side of the yards (north side of 29th Street) and tene ents on 10th Avenue. At the right are builcings on the north side of West 30th Street.
View 1: 8ept. 8, 1930
Views 2-3 Jan. 25,1930
P. L. Sperr

710359f-a.text:
Ninth Avenue (across foreground from left to right)and enwirons, from WW. 29th (intersection at left) to 3O'Street (rimht), showing the New York Central Railroad milk shed and vards extending to Tenth Avenue. The photographer gives his vantage point as the French Hoapital which is on the south side of W. 5Oh Street between Eighth and Ninth Avenues and he is viewirg westward towards the North (Hudson) River and the Wersey Shore. A popular name for this area was "Nells Kitchen".
About Juhe 25, 1930.
Views 1,2 and 3
P.L. Sperr

710363f-a.text:
Ninth Avenue, west side, north from W. 29th to 30th Street, showing a row of old buildings that are shortly to be demolished in con iunction with the razing of the Railroad yards to their rears. Wpon this site will rise the Parcel Post Office
of the Post Office.
January 25, 1930
P. L. Sperr

710360f-a.text:
Ninth Avenue, west side, from West 29th (left) to 30th (right) Streets, as viewed irom the "El" station at 30th Street. Shown is the Parcel Post Office of the Post office being prepared (in No.l) and under improvement (No 2.). Upon this site formerly stood the "Milk Sheds" of the N.Y. entral Railroad. Note in the left background of View 2 the recently erected
Starrett-Lehigh Building.
View 1: April 10, 1931
View 2: Jan. 28, 1932
P. L. Sperr

710360f-b.text:
Ninth Avenue, west side, from West 29th (left) to 30th (right) Streets, as viewed irom the "El" station at 30th Street. View 1: April 10, 1931
